benchmark_details.name: CEBench
benchmark_details.overview: CEBench is an open-source toolkit specifically designed for multi-objective benchmarking that focuses on the critical trade-offs between expenditure and effectiveness required for LLM deployments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address the shortcomings of existing benchmarking toolkits by providing a way to evaluate the cost-effectiveness of LLM deployments.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Latency estimation based on GPU performance is not sufficiently accurate.

data.source: Open-source and public datasets, including DAIC-WOZ and ContractNLI.
data.size: 187 dialogues (DAIC-WOZ dataset) and unspecified for others.
data.annotation: Data from existing datasets is typically obtained (e.g., interviews, contracts).

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model performance during the benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Lower MAE and higher F1 scores indicate better performance.
methodology.validation: The toolkit supports zero-code execution, facilitating easy benchmarking.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Anonymization procedures are followed by dataset providers.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All resources used in this work are open-source resources.
